info.name: Sendly Backend API - Complete
info.description:
Complete API collection for Sendly Marketing Backend - SMS marketing platform for Shopify stores

**Setup Instructions:**
1. Import this collection
2. Import `Sendly_Dev_Store.postman_environment.json`
3. Select the "Sendly Dev Store" environment
4. Update `shopify_access_token` with your full access token from Debug Information

**Authentication:**
- **JWT Token Authentication** (Recommended): Use `Authorization: Bearer <token>` header
  - Get token via `/auth/shopify-token` (Shopify Extension) or `/auth/shopify` (Web App OAuth)
  - Token auto-saved to `jwt_token` collection variable
  - All store-scoped endpoints support JWT tokens
- **Header-based Authentication** (Legacy): Use `X-Shopify-Shop-Domain` header
  - Header is automatically set via collection variable
  - Still supported for backward compatibility

**Base URL:** {{base_url}}

**Dev Store:**
- Shop Domain: {{shopDomain}}
- Access Token: {{shopify_access_token}}
- JWT Token: {{jwt_token}} (auto-saved after authentication)

request.description:
Exchange Shopify App Bridge session token for app JWT token. Used by Shopify Extension.

**Response:**
- `token`: JWT token to use for all subsequent API calls
- `store`: Store information
- `expiresIn`: Token expiration (30d)

**Note:** Save the token from response to `jwt_token` collection variable for use in other requests.

exec: // Auto-save JWT token to collection variable
console.log('JWT token saved to collection variable');

request.description:
Initiate Shopify OAuth flow for Web App. This will redirect to Shopify authorization page.

**Note:** In Postman, you'll see a redirect response. In a real browser, this redirects to Shopify OAuth page.

**Flow:**
1. User authorizes app in Shopify
2. Shopify redirects to `/auth/callback`
3. Backend generates JWT token
4. Redirects to web app with token

Verify JWT token validity and get store information.

**Headers:**
- `Authorization: Bearer <token>`

**Response:**
- `valid`: Boolean indicating token validity
- `store`: Store information (id, shopDomain, credits, currency)
- `token`: Token metadata (storeId, source, exp)

Refresh expired JWT token. Generates a new token with extended expiration.

**Headers:**
- `Authorization: Bearer <token>` (can be expired)

**Response:**
- `token`: New JWT token
- `expiresIn`: Token expiration (30d)

**Note:** Auto-saves new token to collection variable.

exec: // Auto-save refreshed JWT token to collection variable
console.log('Refreshed JWT token saved to collection variable');

request.description:
Generate test JWT token directly from shop domain (DEVELOPMENT ONLY).

**Use this for testing when you don't have a Shopify session token.**

**Body:**
- `shopDomain`: Shop domain (e.g., mystore.myshopify.com)

**Response:**
- `token`: JWT token
- `store`: Store information

**Note:**
- Only works in development mode (NODE_ENV !== 'production')
- Bypasses Shopify session token verification
- Token is auto-saved to `jwt_token` variable

exec: // Auto-save test JWT token to collection variable
console.log('Test JWT token saved to collection variable');

request.description:
Test API endpoint using JWT token authentication.

**Usage:**
1. First call "Generate Test Token" (dev) or "Exchange Shopify Token" to get a token
2. Token is automatically saved to `jwt_token` variable
3. This request uses the token instead of `X-Shopify-Shop-Domain` header

**Note:** All store-scoped endpoints support both:
- Header-based auth: `X-Shopify-Shop-Domain`
- JWT token auth: `Authorization: Bearer <token>`
